results.title: The French lieutenant's woman (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Leon Clore, Juniper Films and Karel Reisz
results.brief_description: Based on the brilliant novel by John Fowles, with the screenplay written by Harold Pinter, “The French Lieutenant’s Woman” is both a classic Victorian love story and an ironic look at an age of double-standard morality. Sarah Woodruff’s chance meeting with Charles Smithson, a young man-about-town who subsequently discards his pretty young fiancee in a wave of passion, sets in motion a series of events that disrupts the quiet fishing and seaside village in England, and profoundly affects the lives of its residents.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leon Clore, Juniper Films and Karel Reisz

results.title: The French horn
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Smith, Milton Ingerson and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”.
One of a series of films designed to assist the musician and music lover. In the film professional musicians demonstrate total range, method of playing and care of the French Horn.

results.title: The French Foreign Legion
results.creator_credit: Newsgroup, Adler Enterprises, Michael du Monceau and Mathieu Mazza
results.brief_description: This video covers the history of the French Foreign Legion, an army of mercenaries whose sense of honour and loyalty transcends national boundaries and commands respect as one of the world’s elite fighting forces. The Legionnaire’s loyalty is to the corps and not to France. They are often loathed by the French as unwelcome foreigners but equally, Legionnaires are considered useful for fighting and dying on behalf of the French in their colonial wars in Africa, Vietnam and various other French colonies across the world. More than 35,000 Legionnaires have died in battle with 8,000 alone being killed at the siege of Dien Bien Phu in Vietnam in 1954. The men who make up the French Foreign Legion are an enigma, often hated and despised for their mercenary attitude by some but highly respected for their fighting skills and effectiveness in battle, particularly guerilla warfare by others - all dependent upon your political and social point of view. Includes interviews, newsreels, stills, historic film footage of many of the battles fought in the 20th century around the world and rare behind-the-scenes footage of Legionnaires in training and in combat including frontline footage during Operation Desert Storm in the Gulf. Narrated by Jackson Bain. Contains some b&w footage.

results.title: The French explorers
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Crawley Films
results.brief_description: Discusses French entry into the age of exploration. Tells of Cartier’s search for the Northwest Passage in 1534, and depicts Champlain’s 1603 expedition to the St. Lawrence River. Also shows the founding of Quebec and immigration of missionaries and traders.

results.title: The French connection (Special edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Philip D'Antoni, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and William Friedkin
results.brief_description: Jimmy “Popeye” Doyle and his partner, Buddy Russo, are New York City police detectives in the field of narcotics. Piecing bits of evidence together they unravel the workings of one of the largest drug-deals in history, involving a massive shipment of heroin from France to the United States. Doyle and Russo tail local New Yorkers Sal Boca and Angie who run a modest, small corner store, yet lead an exuberant and glamorous social life. The policemen slowly figure out this couple’s connection to Charnier, the French kingpin who is smuggling a large quantity of heroin into the city. A riveting car-chase sequence plus a textured, inventive soundscape, keeps “The French connection” engaging throughout. Most admirable is its fusion of art house stylistics with the genre action pic. Cast includes: Gene Hackman, Roy Scheider, Fernando Rey and Tony Lo Bianco.

results.title: The French 'U'
results.brief_description: A class of boys from Heath Clark School, England, demonstrate the action of the mouth, lips, and tongue for the correct pronunciation of the French vowel sound “u”.

results.title: The Freedom railway
results.brief_description: Looks at the Tan-Zam Railway (known locally as the Freedom Railway) which the Chinese have helped to build in Africa. 14,000 Chinese, working day and night with 40,000 Africans, have pushed this railway 1,900 kilometres from Dar es Salaam on the Indian Ocean to Kapiri Mposhi in the heart of Africa. The film conveys how the Chinese and Africans live, in their work camps, and the relationship which has developed between peoples of such different cultures.

results.title: The Frazers of Cabot Cove
results.creator_credit: Paul Fletcher, Green Park Productions, Central Office of Intormation and Humphrey Swingler
results.brief_description: Set against the background of outpost life in Newfoundland, once Britain’s oldest colony and now Canada’s tenth province, the film tells the love-story of Mary Frazer and shows the lives and problems of the simple fishing community in which she lives.

results.title: The Franck-Hertz experiment
results.creator_credit: Educational Services, Physical Sciences Study Committee and Jack Churchill
results.brief_description: A stream of electrons is accelerated through mercury vapour, and it is shown that the kinetic energy of the electrons is transferred to the mercury atoms only in discreet packets of energy. The association of the quantum of energy with a line in the spectrum of mercury is established. The experiment retraced in this film was one of the earliest indications of the existence of internal energy states within the atom.

results.title: The Fragile rice bowl: workers in New China
results.creator_credit: Richard Alexander, Brenda Louie and New Eagle International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China: unleashing the dragon”.
In Communist China, a worker had a guiding concept in life. It was known as the “iron rice bowl” or the notion that one would always be fed. In a brave new China, this concept has been shattered. Profiles Jessica - from her now abandoned job at the state-run factory to the new world of selling cosmetics. Shows the impact of her decision on her own life and the life of her family.
